title: Implement Bitbucket provider adapter
description:
Implement Bitbucket support using the GitProvider abstraction.

## Files to Create
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/bitbucket/index.ts
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/bitbucket/types.ts

## Implementation
- Use Bitbucket Cloud REST API 2.0
- Implement GitProvider interface
- Map Bitbucket concepts to normalized types:
  - Pull Request → PullRequest (same name)
  - Repository → Repository
  - Comments → Comments

## Bitbucket-Specific Considerations
- Bitbucket Apps (OAuth consumers)
- Workspace vs Repository permissions
- Bitbucket Pipelines integration
- Self-hosted Bitbucket Server/Data Center (different API)

## API Client
- Custom fetch-based client
- OAuth 2.0 with refresh tokens

title: Add integration tests for git providers
description:
Create comprehensive tests for the git provider abstraction.

## Test Categories

### Unit Tests
- Provider interface implementation tests
- Webhook payload normalization tests
- Auth token generation tests

### Integration Tests
- GitHub API mock tests
- GitLab API mock tests  
- Bitbucket API mock tests

### E2E Tests
- OAuth flow tests (per provider)
- Webhook delivery tests
- PR operations tests

## Test Files to Create
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/__tests__/github.test.ts
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/__tests__/gitlab.test.ts
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/__tests__/bitbucket.test.ts
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/__tests__/webhook-normalization.test.ts
- packages/convex/convex/__tests__/webhook.test.ts

## Test Data
- Sample webhook payloads for each provider
- Mock API responses
- Test fixtures for normalized types

## Considerations
- Use vitest per project conventions
- No mocking per project rules - use real API calls where possible
- Test files next to implementation files

title: Add Bitbucket App setup and OAuth flow
description:
Create Bitbucket OAuth Consumer and implement integration.

## Bitbucket App Setup
1. Create OAuth consumer at bitbucket.org/[workspace]/workspace/settings/oauth-consumers
2. Configure permissions: repository, pullrequest, webhook
3. Set callback URL to /auth/callback/bitbucket

## Implementation

### OAuth Routes
- GET /auth/bitbucket/authorize - Redirect to Bitbucket OAuth
- GET /auth/callback/bitbucket - Handle OAuth callback

### Stack Auth Integration
- Add Bitbucket as OAuth provider in Stack Auth config
- Store Bitbucket OAuth tokens with refresh token handling

### Environment Variables
```
CMUX_BITBUCKET_APP_KEY=
CMUX_BITBUCKET_APP_SECRET=
BITBUCKET_WEBHOOK_SECRET=
```

### Files to Create
- apps/www/lib/routes/bitbucket.oauth.route.ts
- apps/www/lib/routes/bitbucket.setup.route.ts

### Considerations
- Workspace-level vs Repository-level access
- Bitbucket Cloud vs Bitbucket Server (Data Center)
- Token refresh flow (Bitbucket tokens expire)

title: Design git provider abstraction architecture
description:
Define the core interfaces and architecture for abstracting git providers (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket).

## Key Decisions
- Interface design patterns (strategy pattern, factory pattern)
- Provider configuration structure
- How to handle provider-specific features that don't exist in all providers
- Webhook payload normalization strategy
- Token/auth abstraction approach

## Deliverables
- Architecture document or code comments
- Core TypeScript interfaces
- Provider factory/registry pattern

title: Implement GitLab provider adapter
description:
Implement GitLab support using the GitProvider abstraction.

## Files to Create
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/gitlab/index.ts
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/gitlab/types.ts

## Implementation
- Use GitLab REST API v4 or GraphQL API
- Implement GitProvider interface
- Map GitLab concepts to normalized types:
  - Merge Request → PullRequest
  - Project → Repository
  - Notes → Comments

## GitLab-Specific Considerations
- GitLab Apps vs OAuth Apps vs Personal Access Tokens
- Project access tokens
- Group-level access
- Self-hosted GitLab support (custom base URL)
- MR approval rules (GitLab-specific feature)

## Dependencies
- @gitbeaker/rest or custom fetch-based client
- GitLab webhook types

title: Abstract webhook handling for git providers
description:
Create unified webhook handling that normalizes events across providers.

## Current State
- GitHub webhook handler in packages/convex/convex/github_webhook.ts
- Handles: installation, pull_request, push, workflow_run, check_run, deployment, status, ping

## Webhook Event Mapping

| Normalized Event | GitHub | GitLab | Bitbucket |
|-----------------|--------|--------|-----------|
| pr.opened | pull_request.opened | merge_request.open | pullrequest:created |
| pr.closed | pull_request.closed | merge_request.close | pullrequest:rejected/declined |
| pr.merged | pull_request.closed+merged | merge_request.merge | pullrequest:fulfilled |
| pr.updated | pull_request.synchronize | merge_request.update | pullrequest:updated |
| push | push | push | repo:push |
| comment | issue_comment | note | pullrequest:comment_* |

## Implementation

### Webhook Router
```typescript
// packages/convex/convex/webhook.ts (new unified handler)
async function handleWebhook(provider: string, headers: Headers, body: string) {
  const providerAdapter = getProviderWebhookAdapter(provider)
  const verified = await providerAdapter.verifySignature(headers, body)
  const normalizedEvent = providerAdapter.normalizeEvent(JSON.parse(body))
  // Route to appropriate handler
}
```

### Files to Create
- packages/convex/convex/webhook.ts - Unified entry point
- packages/convex/convex/webhook_adapters/github.ts
- packages/convex/convex/webhook_adapters/gitlab.ts
- packages/convex/convex/webhook_adapters/bitbucket.ts

### Files to Modify
- packages/convex/convex/github_webhook.ts → Extract to adapter pattern
- packages/convex/convex/http.ts → Add routes for /webhook/gitlab, /webhook/bitbucket

title: Add GitLab App setup and OAuth flow
description:
Create GitLab App and implement OAuth integration.

## GitLab App Setup
1. Create GitLab Application at gitlab.com/oauth/applications
2. Configure scopes: api, read_user, read_repository
3. Set callback URL to /auth/callback/gitlab

## Implementation

### OAuth Routes
- GET /auth/gitlab/authorize - Redirect to GitLab OAuth
- GET /auth/callback/gitlab - Handle OAuth callback

### Stack Auth Integration
- Add GitLab as OAuth provider in Stack Auth config
- Store GitLab OAuth tokens

### Environment Variables
```
CMUX_GITLAB_APP_ID=
CMUX_GITLAB_APP_SECRET=
GITLAB_WEBHOOK_SECRET=
```

### Files to Create
- apps/www/lib/routes/gitlab.oauth.route.ts
- apps/www/lib/routes/gitlab.setup.route.ts

### Considerations
- GitLab Groups vs Projects access
- Self-hosted GitLab support (custom baseUrl)
- GitLab Premium/Ultimate features

title: Abstract Hono API routes for git providers
Create provider factory and registry
Update database schema for multi-provider support
description:
Modify Convex schema to support multiple git providers.

## Current GitHub-Specific Tables
- providerConnections - Already has 'provider' field, good!
- pullRequests - Has 'provider' field
- githubWorkflowRuns - GitHub-specific (Actions)
- githubCheckRuns - GitHub-specific (Checks API)
- githubDeployments - GitHub-specific (Deployments API)
- githubCommitStatuses - GitHub-specific (Status API)

## Schema Changes Needed

### 1. Rename/Generalize Tables
```typescript
// Option A: Keep GitHub-specific tables, add parallel tables
// - gitlabPipelines (equivalent to githubWorkflowRuns)
// - gitlabJobs (equivalent to githubCheckRuns)
// - bitbucketPipelines

// Option B: Create generic tables with provider field
// - ciRuns (unified CI/CD runs)
// - deployments (unified deployments)
```

### 2. providerConnections Updates
- Already supports provider field
- Need to add GitLab/Bitbucket specific fields
- Consider: workspace_id (Bitbucket), group_id (GitLab)

### 3. New Indexes
- Add compound indexes on (provider, installationId)
- Add indexes for provider-specific queries

### 4. Migration Strategy
- Keep existing tables working (backward compat)
- Add new fields as optional initially
- Gradual migration of queries

## Files to Modify
- packages/convex/convex/schema.ts

title: Create core GitProvider interface
description:
Implement the core TypeScript interfaces that all git providers must implement.

## Files to Create/Modify
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/types.ts - Core interfaces
- packages/shared/src/git-providers/index.ts - Exports

## Interfaces Needed
```typescript
interface GitProvider {
  name: 'github' | 'gitlab' | 'bitbucket'
  // Authentication
  createAppAuth(): Promise<AuthResult>
  getInstallationToken(installationId: string): Promise<string>
  // Repositories
  listRepositories(installationId: string): AsyncIterable<Repository>
  getRepository(owner: string, repo: string): Promise<Repository>
  // Pull Requests / Merge Requests
  listPullRequests(repo: string, options?: PRListOptions): Promise<PullRequest[]>
  getPullRequest(repo: string, number: number): Promise<PullRequest>
  createPullRequest(repo: string, params: CreatePRParams): Promise<PullRequest>
  getPullRequestPatch(repo: string, number: number): Promise<string>
  getPullRequestFiles(repo: string, number: number): Promise<PRFile[]>
  // Comments
  createPRComment(repo: string, number: number, body: string): Promise<Comment>
  updatePRComment(repo: string, commentId: number, body: string): Promise<Comment>
  // Reactions
  addReaction(repo: string, issueNumber: number, reaction: string): Promise<void>
  // File Contents
  getFileContent(repo: string, path: string, ref?: string): Promise<string>
}
```

## Normalized Types
- Repository, PullRequest, Branch, User, Comment, etc.
- Map provider-specific fields to common fields

title: Abstract authentication layer for git providers
description:
Create unified authentication handling for all git providers.

## Current State (GitHub-only)
- GitHub App with JWT + installation tokens
- OAuth tokens via Stack Auth
- Environment: CMUX_GITHUB_APP_ID, CMUX_GITHUB_APP_PRIVATE_KEY

## Required Abstraction

### Environment Variables Pattern
```
# GitHub
CMUX_GITHUB_APP_ID
CMUX_GITHUB_APP_PRIVATE_KEY
GITHUB_APP_WEBHOOK_SECRET

# GitLab
CMUX_GITLAB_APP_ID
CMUX_GITLAB_APP_SECRET
GITLAB_WEBHOOK_SECRET

# Bitbucket
CMUX_BITBUCKET_APP_KEY
CMUX_BITBUCKET_APP_SECRET
BITBUCKET_WEBHOOK_SECRET
```

### Auth Interface
```typescript
interface ProviderAuth {
  getAppToken(): Promise<string>
  getInstallationToken(installationId: string, permissions?: Permissions): Promise<TokenResult>
  validateWebhookSignature(payload: string, signature: string): boolean
  getOAuthUrl(state: string, scopes: string[]): string
  exchangeOAuthCode(code: string): Promise<OAuthTokens>
}
```

## Files to Modify
- packages/convex/_shared/convex-env.ts - Add new env vars
- packages/convex/_shared/githubApp.ts → refactor to provider pattern
- apps/www/lib/utils/github-app-token.ts → abstract
